description.plain:
Jung Kook (정국) was born as Jeon Jungkook (전정국) on September 1, 1997 in Busan, South Korea. He’s a singer, dancer, songwriter, and producer. He is also known as a main vocalist of the South Korean group BTS.

At the age of 13, Jungkook auditioned for a famous Korean talent show, Superstar K. Though he was not selected, he received offers from seven different entertainment agencies, one of them being Big Hit Entertainment which had previously signed the rapper RM. Having seen the rapper’s outstanding performance, Jungkook decided to join the same company.

In 2013, at the age of 15, Jungkook debuted with BTS.

Jungkook is often called Golden Maknae (황금막내). The nickname was given by his bandmate, RM, at the beginning of their career. ‘Maknae’ is a Korean term used to refer to the youngest member of the group, and ‘golden’ comes from how multi-talented Jungkook is as he sings, dances, raps and plays various instruments.

Through the years in BTS, Jungkook took part in songwriting, composing and producing process. He co-created, among others, “Run,” “Autumn Leaves,” “Magic Shop,” and “My Time.” He is credited officially as a writer/composer of over 15 tracks by Korea Music Copyright Association (KOMCA).

In 2017, Jungkook showed his interest in filmmaking by releasing series of short movies—under the G.C.F (Golden Closet Film)—that he directed, shooted and edited by himself.

Combining his two passions, music and film, in 2020 Jungkook co-wrote “Your eyes tell,” a song in Japanese and English that serves as the lead soundtrack for Japanese movie with the same title—Your Eyes Tell (きみの瞳が問いかけている). The song has reached #1 on iTunes in 116 countries.

The same year he wrote another lead soundtrack, “Film out,” for the Japanese movie  Signal: Long-Term Unsolved Case Investigation Team (劇場版シグナル 長期未解決事件捜査班).

In 2018, along with the other members of BTS, he was awarded the fifth-class Hwagwan Order of Cultural Merit by the President of South Korea for the contribution to Korean culture. Adding to that, in September 2020, as a member of BTS, Jungkook gave a speech at the United Nations General Assembly.

songs.full_title: Still With You by Jung Kook (정국)
songs.title: Still With You

description.plain:
Released as a part of the BTS' anniversary celebration known as Festa, over a jazzy R&B instrumental, the song reminisces missing someone and believing in being together.

The Soundcloud link of the song has the words ‘thankyouarmy2020’ in it, which indicates that the song is for and about ARMY (BTS fans).

“Still With You” is Jung Kook’s first official solo release.

songs.embed_content: Read “Still With You” by Jung Kook (정국) on Genius
songs.recording_location: Big Hit Studio (Seoul, South Korea), Dogg Bounce (Seoul, South Korea)

날 스치는 그대의 옅은 그 목소리
내 이름을 한 번만 더 불러주세요
얼어버린 노을 아래 멈춰 서있지만

나 정말 무너질 것 같아

함께 웃고 함께 울고

언제쯤일까
다시 그댈 마주한다면?
눈을 보고 말할래요
보고 싶었어요

[Chorus]
황홀했던 기억 속에
나 홀로 춤을 춰도 비가 내리잖아
이 안개가 걷힐 때쯤
젖은 발로 달려갈게
그때 날 안아줘

[Verse 2]
저 달이 외로워 보여서
밤하늘에 환하게 울고 있는 것 같아서
언젠가 아침이 오는 걸 알면서도
별처럼 너의 하늘에 머물고 싶었어

[Pre-Chorus]
하루를 그 순간을
이렇게 될 걸 알았다면
더 담아뒀을 텐데
언제쯤일까
다시 그댈 마주한다면
눈을 보고 말할래요
보고 싶었어요

황홀했던 기억 속에
나 홀로 춤을 춰도 비가 내리잖아

젖은 발로 달려갈게

[Outro]
날 바라보는 희미한 미소 뒤편에
아름다운 보랏빛을 그려볼래요
서로 발걸음이 안 맞을 수도 있지만

songs.title: 2U (Cover)

description.plain:
Released as a gift for his fans on his 21st birthday, Jungkook of BTS performed a cover of David Guetta’s track, “2U” featuring Justin Bieber.

The song joined a growing list of covers performed by BTS members on their official SoundCloud and was the third Justin Bieber song covered by Jungkook on the platform following, “Purpose” and “Nothing Like Us.”

The instrumentation on the cover is completely opposite from the original track as Jungkook turns the dance banger into a soft piano ballad, featuring a mellow melody with vocal arrangement by Jungkook himself.

songs.embed_content: Read “2U (Cover)” by Jung Kook (정국) on Genius

body.plain:
Released as a gift for his fans on his 21st birthday, Jungkook of BTS performed a cover of David Guetta’s track, “2U” featuring Justin Bieber.

The song joined a growing list of covers performed by BTS members on their official SoundCloud and was the third Justin Bieber song covered by Jungkook on the platform following, “Purpose” and “Nothing Like Us.”

The instrumentation on the cover is completely opposite from the original track as Jungkook turns the dance banger into a soft piano ballad, featuring a mellow melody with vocal arrangement by Jungkook himself.

songs.title: Decalcomania*

description.plain:
On his 22nd birthday, Jung Kook told that he was unable to put up a cover for ARMY (BTS‘ fans), as usual, but instead of that he uploaded on Twitter the demo version of the original song he wrote. The song had no title, but fans named it “Decalcomania” after the part of the lyrics.

‘Decalcomania’ is an art term invented in the 18th century to describe the process of generating images by applying paint to one surface and then being folded to create a mirrored pattern (thus is often called a ‘butterfly print’) or transferred on any other surface.

On August 2021, during the fan meeting, after being asked about the full version of “Decalcomania,” Jung Kook shared that he deleted the track’s files, but also reassured that he can record it again.

songs.embed_content: Read “Decalcomania*” by Jung Kook (정국) on Genius

body.plain:
On his 22nd birthday, Jung Kook told that he was unable to put up a cover for ARMY (BTS‘ fans), as usual, but instead of that he uploaded on Twitter the demo version of the original song he wrote. The song had no title, but fans named it “Decalcomania” after the part of the lyrics.

‘Decalcomania’ is an art term invented in the 18th century to describe the process of generating images by applying paint to one surface and then being folded to create a mirrored pattern (thus is often called a ‘butterfly print’) or transferred on any other surface.

On August 2021, during the fan meeting, after being asked about the full version of “Decalcomania,” Jung Kook shared that he deleted the track’s files, but also reassured that he can record it again.
